distribution.text: Copyright 2023 SUSE LLC. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
libXi was updated to fix two security issues.

These security issues were fixed:
- CVE-2016-7945: Integer overflows in libXI can cause out of boundary memory access or endless loops (Denial of Service) (bsc#1002998).
- CVE-2016-7946: Insufficient validation of data in libXI can cause out of boundary memory access or endless loops (Denial of Service) (bsc#1002998).
notes.title: Description of the patch

notes.text: CSAF 2.0 data is provided by SUSE under the Creative Commons License 4.0 with Attribution (CC-BY-4.0).
notes.title: Terms of use

notes.text: Multiple integer overflows in X.org libXi before 1.7.7 allow remote X servers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds memory access or infinite loop) via vectors involving length fields.
notes.title: Vulnerability description
